description.narrative: (i) Construction of critical business infrastructure: The Project will add much-needed supply of international standard hospitality infrastructure to Yangon. International standard business infrastructure such as these are of critical importance in driving foreign investments in the country. (ii) Improvement of hotel service standards: The Project will improve the standards of accommodation facilities and services available to travelers and the business community. While Shangri-La''s extensive training and high operating standards will assure guests of a high-quality product, it will also encourage broad improvements in the standards of existing hotels. (iii) Employment creation and knowledge transfer: The Project will create a significant number of direct and indirect employment opportunities for the local community both during construction and operational phases. It will also promote the transfer of hotel management expertise and knowledge to the local staff. (iv) Benefits to the local economy and local linkages: The Project will help create demand for locally-sourced materials, services, and labor both during the construction and operation stages. The Project is expected to generate additional sales for local small and medium enterprises, including a wide range of goods and service providers. (v) Increase in tax revenues and foreign exchange: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and foreign exchange inflow, particularly as it is expected that a significant portion of the users (hotel guests and apartment lessees) will be foreign nationals and that the majority of Project revenues will be paid in foreign currency. (vi) Private sector development: The presence of these large scale developments in Yangon will send a positive signal about Myanmar, particularly to other foreign investors who are considering investments in the country.

Shangri-La Asia Limited (Shangri-La) is undertaking the following developments in Yangon, Myanmar: (i) construction and refurbishment of the existing 485-room Traders Hotel in downtown Yangon; and (ii) development of the 240-room Shangri-La branded service apartments on a 15-acre site near the Kandawgyi Lake (together, the Project).
